## 1. Read the data
```{r}
cocktails <- read_tsv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nthun/cocktail-balance/master/cocktail_data.tsv")
```
## 2. Transform the data table and clean the ingredient variable
```{r}
colnames(cocktails)
cocktails_clean <- cocktails %>%
  separate_rows(ingredients, sep = ",") %>% 
  mutate(ingredients = str_trim(ingredients)) %>%
  mutate(ingredients = str_remove_all(ingredients, "\\b[0-9]+\\s?[a-zA-Z/%]+\\b")) %>%
  mutate(ingredients = str_remove_all(ingredients, "[0-9]+\\.?[0-9]*%\\s*abv")) %>%
  mutate(ingredients = str_squish(ingredients))
head(cocktails_clean)
```
## 3. All ingredients in alphabetical order
```{r}
ingredients_list <- cocktails_clean %>%
  distinct(ingredients) %>%    
  arrange(ingredients)  
view(ingredients_list)
```

## 4. Number of unique ingredients
```{r}
num_unique_ingredients <- ingredients_list %>%
  nrow()
num_unique_ingredients
```
## 5. What are the top 10 ingredients?
```{r}
top_ingredients <- cocktails_clean %>%
  count(ingredients, sort = TRUE) %>% 
  slice_max(n, n = 10, with_ties = TRUE)
top_ingredients
```
## 2. step correction
```{r}
cocktails_clean <- cocktails %>%
  mutate(ingredients = str_remove_all(ingredients, "\\b[0-9]+\\s?[a-zA-Z/%]+\\b")) %>%  # mennyiségek törlése
  mutate(ingredients = str_remove_all(ingredients, "[0-9]+\\.?[0-9]*%\\s*abv")) %>%      # % abv törlése
  mutate(ingredients = str_replace_all(ingredients, "<br/?>", ",")) %>%                  # HTML sortörés cseréje vesszőre
  separate_rows(ingredients, sep = ",") %>%                                              # minden hozzávaló külön sorba
  mutate(ingredients = str_trim(ingredients)) %>%                                        # felesleges szóközök eltávolítása
  filter(ingredients != "")        
```

## 2. again in smaller steps
```{r}
library(stringr)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)

cocktails_clean <- cocktails %>%
  # 1) Normalising line breaks
  mutate(ingredients = str_replace_all(ingredients, "<br\\s*/?>", "\n"),
         ingredients = str_replace_all(ingredients, "\r", "")) %>%

  # 2) Delete the separate number lines
  mutate(ingredients = str_replace_all(ingredients, "\\n\\s*\\d+\\s*\\n", "\n")) %>%

  # 3) We remove numbering and bullet points
  mutate(ingredients = str_replace_all(ingredients, "(^|\\n)\\s*\\.?\\s*\\d+\\s*\\.?\\s*", "\n"),
         ingredients = str_replace_all(ingredients, "(^|\\n)\\s*\\.\\s+", "\n")) %>%

  # 4) Deleting parentheses, percentages, and units of measurement
  mutate(ingredients = str_remove_all(ingredients, "\\(.*?\\)"),
         ingredients = str_remove_all(ingredients, "[0-9]+\\.?[0-9]*%\\s*abv"),
         ingredients = str_remove_all(ingredients, "\\b[0-9]+\\s*(oz|ml|cl|tsp|tbsp|cup|part|dash(?:es)?|barspoon)s?\\b"),
         ingredients = str_replace_all(ingredients, "[/\\\\]+", "/")) %>%

  # 5) Breakdown into new rows
  separate_rows(ingredients, sep = "[,\\n]") %>%

  # 6) Filtering out unnecessary elements
  mutate(ingredients = str_squish(ingredients),
         ingredients = str_trim(ingredients)) %>%
  filter(ingredients != "",
         !str_detect(ingredients, "^[\\d\\.\\s]+$"),
         !str_detect(ingredients, "^\\.$"))

# Check
cocktails_clean %>% distinct(ingredients) %>% slice_head(n = 50) %>% print(n = 50)
```
## 2. Robust cleaning
# Robust cleaning pipeline (futtasd egyetlen chunkban)
```{r}
library(dplyr); library(stringr); library(tidyr)

cocktails_clean <- cocktails %>%
  # 0) munkamásolat
  mutate(ingredients = as.character(ingredients)) %>%

  # 1) HTML tagek és HTML sortörések -> vessző (egységesítés)
  mutate(ingredients = str_replace_all(ingredients, "<br\\s*/?>", ",")) %>%
  mutate(ingredients = str_replace_all(ingredients, "<[^>]+>", ",")) %>%

  # 2) Unicode szemetek normalizálása / eltávolítása
  mutate(ingredients = str_replace_all(ingredients, "\\\\u[0-9a-fA-F]{4}", " "),
         ingredients = str_replace_all(ingredients, "[^\\x00-\\x7F]", " ")) %>%    

  # 3) Slash-szerű elválasztókat (amik nem törtvonalak) egységesítjük vesszőre
  #    De előtte eltávolítjuk törtmennyiségeket (pl. 1/2) hogy ne törjük fel őket feleslegesen.
  mutate(ingredients = str_replace_all(ingredients, "\\b\\d+\\s*/\\s*\\d+\\b", " ")) %>%
  mutate(ingredients = str_replace_all(ingredients, "[/\\\\]+", ",")) %>%

  # 4) Számozás / pont a sor elején vagy külön sorban: "1.", "2", ". lemon" stb. -> eltávolítjuk
  mutate(ingredients = str_replace_all(ingredients, "(^|,|\\n)\\s*\\.?\\s*\\d+\\s*\\.?\\s*(,|$)", ",")) %>%

  # 5) Zárójelek és tartalmuk, %abv, mértékegységek eltávolítása
  mutate(ingredients = str_remove_all(ingredients, "\\([^\\)]*\\)"),                     # ( ... )
         ingredients = str_remove_all(ingredients, "[0-9]+\\.?[0-9]*%\\s*abv"),          # 47% abv
         ingredients = str_remove_all(ingredients, "\\b\\d+\\s*(oz|ml|cl|tsp|tbsp|bsp|cup|part|dash(?:es)?|barspoon|drop(?:s)?)s?\\b"), 
         ingredients = str_remove_all(ingredients, "\\b\\d+\\b")) %>%                  
  
  # 6) Felbontás vesszők és új sorok mentén
  separate_rows(ingredients, sep = "[,\\n;]") %>%

  # 7) Levágás, több szóköz eltávolítása, kis lettersé alakítás (opcionális)
  mutate(ingredients = str_squish(ingredients),
         ingredients = str_trim(ingredients),
         ingredients = str_to_lower(ingredients)) %>%

  # 8) Eltávolítjuk a maradék "szemetet" - csak számok/pontok vagy nagyon rövid/értelmetlen elemek
  filter(ingredients != "",
         !str_detect(ingredients, "^[\\d\\.\\s]+$"),
         nchar(ingredients) > 1,
         !str_detect(ingredients, "^\\W+$")) %>%

  # 9) Normáljuk az elnevezéseket (opcionális: pl. 'lemon juice' <-> 'lemon juice' már jó)
  mutate(ingredients = str_replace_all(ingredients,
                                      c("^lemon\\s*juice$" = "lemon juice",
                                        "^lime\\s*juice$"  = "lime juice"))) %>%

  # 10) opcionális: ismét összeszedjük a distinct neveket
  distinct(name, ingredients, .keep_all = TRUE)

# Ellenőrzés: nézzük a furcsa elemeket, amik még vezető perjellel vagy számokkal kezdődnek
cocktails_clean %>% filter(str_detect(ingredients, "^[^a-z0-9]")) %>% distinct(ingredients) %>% print(n = 100)

```
## 2. cleaning further
```{r}
cocktails_clean <- cocktails_clean %>%
  mutate(ingredients = str_replace_all(ingredients, "(^|,)\\s*\\d+\\s*\\.\\s*", ",")) %>%
  mutate(ingredients = str_squish(ingredients)) %>%
  mutate(
    ingredients = str_remove(ingredients, "^\\d+\\s*"),
    ingredients = str_remove(ingredients, "^\\.*\\s*")
  )

cocktails_clean %>%
  filter(str_detect(ingredients, "^\\d")) %>%
  distinct(ingredients)
```
